intro: Aspidosperma pallidiflorum, commonly known as the paleflower aspidosperma, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and showy, pale yellow to white flowers. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in moist, well-drained soils. It has small, elliptical leaves and produces berries that contain toxic compounds. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal potential, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and research settings.
